In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, reading a **spellbook of healing** allows you to learn the **spell of healing**. This is an [emergency spell](/wiki/Emergency_spell "Emergency spell").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Messages](#Messages)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 See also](#See_also)
- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Healers start with a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") spellbook of healing. [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") have a 1 in 3 chance of starting with this spellbook as well.

## Effects

Healing is a [directional spell](/wiki/Directional_spell "Directional spell") that heals its target(s) for 6d4 HP and, at Skilled or higher, cures [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This will awaken a sleeping monster without angering it. The effect is similar to an uncursed [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing"), except that the spell cannot increase maximum HP.

Casting this spell at a [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") or [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") monster will yield an [alignment](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") bonus for each monster affected, even if it was already at maximum HP; [Lawfuls](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") and [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") gain one alignment point, while [chaotics](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") besides Healers lose one point.

[Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence") will actually take 3d4 damage from the spell of healing, with the damage halved due to his guaranteed [monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance").

## Strategy

Healing is the easiest spell in the [healing spell](/wiki/Healing_spell "Healing spell") school, and is thus a good spell to train that skill with. It is also a useful utility spell in general, especially for non-spellcaster classes who will probably not be using their power pool for anything else - being able to heal oneself is universally beneficial. Once you learn [extra healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_extra_healing "Spellbook of extra healing"), however, this spell is useful only when aiming to conserving power.

Although casting this spell at yourself is the most common use, remember that it is directional; using it to heal a pet(s) is a viable strategy, especially in the early-game or for [pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist") players.

This spell is most useful when it would be impractical or dangerous to wait for HP to recover, such as on deeper [dungeon levels](/wiki/Dungeon_level "Dungeon level"), or when [polymorphed](/wiki/Self_polymorph "Self polymorph") into a monster (which significantly reduces your natural regeneration).

## Messages

- \<Monster> looks better.

## History

Before [3.6.2](/wiki/3.6.2 "3.6.2"), this spell only cured blindness when cast at a monster at any skill level. 3.6.2 fixes this and also fixes a bug that prevented both this spell and the spell of extra healing from correctly healing untimed monster blindness.

## See also

- [spellbook of extra healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_extra_healing "Spellbook of extra healing")
- [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 2471](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/zap.c#L2471)
